meanings.sent1: The room's inelegance was evident in its mismatched furniture.
meanings.sent2: Her outfit's inelegance stood out in a sea of stylish attire.
meanings.sent3: Despite the inelegance of his dance moves, he always had fun on the dance floor.
meanings.sent4: The inelegance of the old building added to its charm and character.
meanings.sent5: The inelegance of the handwriting made it difficult to read.

meanings.definition: The quality of being unrefined or clumsy
meanings.sent1: The cake's inelegance was evident in its lopsided layers.
meanings.sent2: His inelegance in social situations often led to awkward encounters.
meanings.sent3: The inelegance of his painting style gave his art a unique flair.
meanings.sent4: The inelegance of the robot's movements made it endearing to the audience.
meanings.sent5: The inelegance of the solution surprised everyone with its simplicity.
